solid pick but collectable slots are super premium. The benefit of this card is that as a 0 cost it gives you a good card you can spam with soulforge + omen. 1 blur for 0 in general is good value however it directly competes with 3 blur for 1 energy from another collectable card and blur can be a bit weaker then expected with decks that have a lot of temporary HP.

since louses are only in act 1 and you don't have much essence I don't advice taking this from the first group of louses, but you can take it from a second group much more often (and from the louse hermit has)
blur is noticeably really strong with <billow>

Uncommon Skill / 3 :energy_collector: / The Collector / Downfall

messages.content: soulforge is being reworked soon

baseball nerf?? sadge.

I've generally had good experiences with this card, but I wouldn't say it's amazing or anything. What I like about is that it's a 0 cost collected card that can help with mitigation in the early game without actually being a skill in your maindeck. You can fight some louses fairly early in the game, pick 1, maybe 2 of these up as cheap ways to protect against taking too much chip damage, get the benefits of drawing 6 cards a turn very early on, and be able to cast them easily alongside your regular cards since they are 0 cost. I often find myself taking 1-2 defensive collected cards in the early game to protect against chip damage, without taking the downside of having actual defensive skill cards in my deck that perform very poorly against nob and tri-sentries. 

I have not tried the blur/barricade strategy with this, but I can believe that it's possible if you get enough copies and some forgeries going. Definitely plays well with billow to stack large doom values up. I do think that collected cards are very heavily competing with each other, since each one you take makes it harder to draw the others (pretty significantly too, since you only naturally draw one a turn). Spheric Guardian is a much stronger version of this effect, and there are also several very strong collected cards (some of the boss rares, sentries, book of stabbing, gremlin leader, nemesis, transient, etc.) that stand out as being much more important than this kind of effect. I think when playing collector, you have to make a decision about whether you will take reasonable collected cards like this to help you in the early game, or if you are going to be really picky and just try to take only the absolute strongest collected cards later in the run (personally I lean towards the former). 

This particular card is bad into nob (if drawn after turn 1), great into sentries and lagavulin, and quite helpful against act 1 hallways. In act 2 the reactive block works well against multi-hit enemies.

It's not very impactful in acts 3 and 4, but hopefully it did enough work for you by then to snowball into advantages elsewhere. The upgrade is pretty good, +3 on a 0 cost card, though there aren't many ways to specifically make that happen. Good with ink bottle and letter opener as a 0 cost skill. I think it's in a pretty good place balance wise, I have more of an issue with some of the really dominant collectible cards that make it difficult to justify picking something reasonable but unexciting like this.

The block is gimmicky, and 1 blur for 0 cost is pretty low impact. I haven't gotten to A20 on collector yet (on A14, I have lost only 2 games) but I've found that most strategies work just because the character is inherently strong.

messages.content: Here's the thing you may think this card is somewhat weak but the ability to retain block (for free BTW) is really strong and odds are if your seeing this card there's likely multiple louses so you would likely take multiple of these the block on taking damage part is pretty trash honestly (unless you get a dagger to trigger it without eating a shitton of damage) but since this card is free it makes it very easy to spam with omen and makes dragons trove a much better card since it's just extending the blur forgery also works as an extension for this card it's definitely not the strongest collectible but to say it's mid especially with how good retaining block can be in this game is an L take IMO
